sentence.Network_en: Always plant stakes to skewer your own cavalry on.
sentence.Network_cn: 放置木桩,然后就可以串烤你的骑兵了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: of unknown origin

entry.def: A skewer is a long metal pin which is used to hold pieces of food together during cooking.
If you skewer something, you push a long, thin, pointed object through it.

example.ex: He skewered his victim through the neck.
example.tran: 他用扦子刺穿了受害人的脖子。

means.word_mean: 1. a long pin for holding meat in position while it is being roasted
